info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 6:11PM MDT until August 11 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 915 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Roan Creek amd Kimball Creek on and near the Pine Gulch burn scar - Some locations that will experience flooding include... areas near Roan and Kimball Creeks
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
